sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme microSD
sdcards.pros: Fast, reliable, widely available, excellent warranty
sdcards.cons: Mid-price point

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional 633x
sdcards.pros: Excellent build quality, good warranty, professional-grade
sdcards.cons: Slightly more expensive than SanDisk

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas Select
sdcards.pros: Budget-friendly, still meets minimum specs
sdcards.cons: Slower sustained write speed

sdcards.name: SanDisk Ultra microSD
sdcards.pros: Budget-friendly, reliable, widely available
sdcards.cons: None really

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas Go! Plus
sdcards.pros: Good value, fast, reliable
sdcards.cons: Slightly pricier than SanDisk

sdcards.name: Crucial MX500 microSD
sdcards.pros: Reliable, good price
sdcards.cons: Less common than SanDisk

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional 1000x
sdcards.pros: Professional quality, excellent performance
sdcards.cons: Premium pricing

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas Go!
sdcards.pros: Budget option, still V30
sdcards.cons: Lower write speed than premium options

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme PRO CFast 2.0
sdcards.pros: Professional-grade, extremely fast
sdcards.cons: Expensive

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional 1000x SD UHS-II
sdcards.pros: Great for SD slot, professional performance
sdcards.cons: Slower than CFast

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme PRO SD UHS-II
sdcards.pros: Professional grade, fast, reliable
sdcards.cons: Premium pricing

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional Silver SD UHS-II
sdcards.pros: Excellent build, professional performance
sdcards.cons: Premium price

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas Go! Pro SD
sdcards.pros: Extremely fast UHS-II
sdcards.cons: Higher price

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme PRO microSD
sdcards.pros: Professional-grade, very fast
sdcards.cons: Premium pricing

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional Silver microSD
sdcards.pros: Good balance of speed and price
sdcards.cons: None really

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas Go! Pro V30
sdcards.pros: Budget option, 4K capable
sdcards.cons: Can't reliably record 8K

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional 1000x V60
sdcards.pros: Professional-grade, excellent for 8K
sdcards.cons: Expensive

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme PRO CFexpress
sdcards.pros: Fastest available, 8K ready
sdcards.cons: Very expensive

sdcards.name: Nikon XQD Memory Card
sdcards.pros: Official Nikon solution
sdcards.cons: Legacy format, expensive

sdcards.name: SanDisk microSD ROG Xbox Ally
sdcards.pros: Officially licensed for ROG Ally, optimized performance with up to 200MB/s read speed, engineered specifically for gaming and fast game downloads
sdcards.cons: Premium pricing compared to standard microSD alternatives

sdcards.name: SanDisk MAX ENDURANCE microSD
sdcards.pros: Built for extreme reliability with up to 120,000 hours of continuous recording. The ideal choice for dash cams and home security cameras that are always on.
sdcards.cons: Slower write speeds compared to performance-focused cards; not ideal for professional photography or 8K video.

sdcards.name: Sony TOUGH G-Series SD Card
sdcards.pros: Extremely fast V90 speeds for high-bitrate 8K video and rapid-burst RAW photography. One-piece molded design is incredibly durable, waterproof (IP68), and lacks a fragile write-protect switch.
sdcards.cons: Very expensive. Complete overkill for any device that doesn't explicitly require V90 speeds.

sdcards.name: Samsung PRO Endurance microSD
sdcards.pros: Engineered for long-lasting continuous recording, rated for up to 140,000 hours. A top-tier, reliable choice for security cameras, dash cams, and body cams.
sdcards.cons: Optimized for longevity, not peak speed. Not recommended for use cases that require clearing a large camera buffer quickly.

sdcards.name: Samsung EVO Select microSD
sdcards.pros: Excellent performance for the price. A fantastic all-around card for smartphones, tablets, Nintendo Switch, and 4K action cameras. Great value and reliability.
sdcards.cons: Not as fast as Samsung's 'PRO' series. Not designed for the continuous rewriting required by dash cams.

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme PRO CFexpress Type A
sdcards.pros: Exceptional speeds, required for Sony FX3/FX30 high-bitrate modes. Widely trusted brand.
sdcards.cons: Very expensive, only useful for cameras with CFexpress Type A slots.

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional 633x SD
sdcards.pros: Affordable, reliable, trusted by many photographers for general-purpose use.
sdcards.cons: Slower than UHS-II cards for bursts and 4K/6K high-bitrate recording.

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme SD UHS-I
sdcards.pros: Fast, reliable, excellent for 4K video and burst photography. Good balance of performance and price.
sdcards.cons: Slower than UHS-II alternatives for professional 8K work.

sdcards.name: SanDisk Ultra SD UHS-I
sdcards.pros: Budget-friendly, reliable from a trusted brand, suitable for standard photography and HD video.
sdcards.cons: Slower speeds than V30 cards, not ideal for 4K video.

sdcards.name: SanDisk Extreme PRO SD UHS-I
sdcards.pros: Very fast UHS-I performance, excellent for 4K video recording and high-speed burst photography. Professional-grade reliability.
sdcards.cons: Slower than UHS-II alternatives. Premium pricing for UHS-I.

sdcards.name: ADATA Premier microSD
sdcards.pros: Ultra-budget option, still V30 rated, solid reliability from established brand
sdcards.cons: Lower write speed than competitors, less widely available

sdcards.name: Transcend Standard microSD
sdcards.pros: Great value, reliable Taiwanese manufacturer, good performance for budget tier
sdcards.cons: Slightly slower sustained speeds than SanDisk Ultra

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas Go! Plus Ultra
sdcards.pros: V90 rated for superior sustained performance, A2 app performance, excellent for gaming handhelds
sdcards.cons: Premium pricing compared to standard Canvas Go!

sdcards.name: ADATA Premier Pro microSD
sdcards.pros: Great mid-range performance, fast write speeds, solid warranty
sdcards.cons: Less brand recognition than SanDisk or Lexar

sdcards.name: Transcend DrivePro 300S
sdcards.pros: Purpose-built for dashcams, 160,000 hours endurance rating, excellent durability for continuous recording
sdcards.cons: Slower write speed than performance cards, not ideal for video or photography

sdcards.name: SanDisk Ultra SD UHS-II
sdcards.pros: Budget SD option with UHS-II support, reliable SanDisk quality, good value
sdcards.cons: Class 10 rating, not V-rated for sustained performance on demanding cameras

sdcards.name: Transcend Superior SD UHS-II
sdcards.pros: Budget-friendly with V30 rating, UHS-II capable, excellent value
sdcards.cons: Lower write speed than mid-range options

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas React SD UHS-II
sdcards.pros: Extremely fast V90 performance, excellent for professional 4K/8K work, competitive pricing
sdcards.cons: Premium price point, may be overkill for casual users

sdcards.name: Lexar Professional 1000x microSD V60
sdcards.pros: Professional V60 microSD, excellent for action cameras and drones, fast sustained writes
sdcards.cons: Premium pricing, may be more than casual users need

sdcards.name: Kingston Canvas React Pro microSD
sdcards.pros: V90 rated, excellent performance for action cameras, competitive pricing
sdcards.cons: Less brand recognition than SanDisk or Lexar in microSD space
